btrplace.solver.choco

Interface ReconfigurationProblem

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultReconfigurationProblem

    public interface ReconfigurationProblem
    Interface for the Reconfiguration Problem.

    VM and node identifiers are translated to a position in an array.

    Author:
    Fabien Hermenier

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentVMLocation

        int getCurrentVMLocation(int vmIdx)
        Get the current location of a running or a sleeping VM.
        Parameters:
        vmIdx - the index of the VM
        Returns:
        the node index if exists, -1 if the VM is unknown

      • getNodes

        Node[] getNodes()
        Get all the nodes in the model. Indexed by their identifier.
        Returns:
        an array of node identifiers.

      • getVMs

        VM[] getVMs()
        Get all the VMs in the model. Indexed by their identifier.
        Returns:
        an array of VM identifiers

      • getSourceModel

        Model getSourceModel()
        Get the initial Model.
        Returns:
        a model

      • getFutureRunningVMs

        Set<VM> getFutureRunningVMs()
        Get the VMs that will be in the running state at the end of the reconfiguration process.
        Returns:
        a set, may be empty

      • getFutureReadyVMs

        Set<VM> getFutureReadyVMs()
        Get the VMs that will be in the ready state at the end of the reconfiguration process.
        Returns:
        a set, may be empty

      • getFutureSleepingVMs

        Set<VM> getFutureSleepingVMs()
        Get the VMs that will be in the sleeping state at the end of the reconfiguration process.
        Returns:
        a set, may be empty

      • getFutureKilledVMs

        Set<VM> getFutureKilledVMs()
        Get the VMs that will be killed at the end of the reconfiguration process.
        Returns:
        a set, may be empty

      • getNextState

        VMState getNextState(VM v)
        Get the next state for a given VM.
        Parameters:
        v - the VM
        Returns:
        the state if the VM is known, null otherwise

      • getStart

        solver.variables.IntVar getStart()
        Get the starting moment of the reconfiguration.
        Returns:
        a variable equals to 0

      • getEnd

        solver.variables.IntVar getEnd()
        Get the end moment of the reconfiguration
        Returns:
        a variable, should be equals to the last end moment of actions

      • getVM

        int getVM(VM vm)
        Get the index of a VM
        Parameters:
        vm - the VM
        Returns:
        its index or -1 in case of failure

      • getVM

        VM getVM(int idx)
        Get the VM with a specified index.
        Parameters:
        idx - the index of the VM
        Returns:
        the VM or null in case of failure

        Get the transition associated to a given VM.
        Parameters:
        id - the VM identifier
        Returns:
        the associated transition if exists, null otherwise

      • getVMActions

        VMTransition[] getVMActions(Set<VM> id)
        Get the transitions associated to a set of VMs.
        Parameters:
        id - the VMs
        Returns:
        an array of transition. The order is provided by the collection iterator.

      • getNodeActions

        Get all the nodes transition.
        Returns:
        a list of transitions.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the associated transition if exists, null otherwise

      • getDurationEvaluators

        DurationEvaluators getDurationEvaluators()
        Get the evaluator to estimate the duration of the actions.

      • solve

        ReconfigurationPlan solve(int timeLimit,
                          boolean optimize)
                   throws SolverException
        Solve the RP and return a solution if exists.
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - the timeout in second. Must be superior to 0 to be considered
        optimize - true to make the solver try to improve the first computed solution.
        Returns:
        a plan if the solving process succeeded, null if the solver was not able to compute a solution.
        Throws:
        SolverException - if an error occurs

      • getSolver

        solver.Solver getSolver()
        Get the Solver used to model this problem.
        Returns:
        the Solver

      • makeHostVariable

        solver.variables.IntVar makeHostVariable(Object... n)
        Create a variable that indicate the placement of an element on a node.
        Parameters:
        n - the variable label as a possible concatenation of objects
        Returns:
        a variable

      • makeCurrentHost

        solver.variables.IntVar makeCurrentHost(VM vmId,
                                        Object... n)
                                 throws SolverException
        Create a variable that indicate the current placement of a VM. The variable is then already instantiated
        Parameters:
        vmId - the VM identifier
        n - the variable label
        Returns:
        the created variable
        Throws:
        SolverException - if an error occurred while creating the variable

      • makeCurrentNode

        solver.variables.IntVar makeCurrentNode(Node nId,
                                        Object... n)
                                 throws SolverException
        Create a variable that indicate a given node. The variable is then already instantiated
        Parameters:
        nId - the node identifier
        n - the variable label
        Returns:
        the created variable
        Throws:
        SolverException - if an error occurred while creating the variable

      • makeUnboundedDuration

        solver.variables.IntVar makeUnboundedDuration(Object... n)
        Create a variable denoting a duration.
        Parameters:
        n - the variable label. The toString() representation of the objects will be used
        Returns:
        the created variable.

      • makeDuration

        solver.variables.IntVar makeDuration(int ub,
                                     int lb,
                                     Object... n)
                              throws SolverException
        Create a variable that indicate a moment.
        Parameters:
        ub - the variable upper bound
        lb - the variable lower bound
        n - the variable label. The toString() representation of the objects will be used
        Returns:
        the created variable with a upper-bound necessarily lesser than getEnd().getUB()
        Throws:
        SolverException - if the bounds are not valid

      • getView

        ChocoView getView(String id)
        Get the view associated to a given identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - the view identifier
        Returns:
        the view if exists, null otherwise

      • getViews

        Collection<String> getViews()
        Get all the declared view keys.
        Returns:
        a collection of keys, may be empty

      • addView

        boolean addView(ChocoView v)
        Add a view. There must not be a view with a same identifier already in.
        Parameters:
        v - the view to add
        Returns:
        true iff the view has been added.

      • getNbRunningVMs

        solver.variables.IntVar[] getNbRunningVMs()
        Get the amount of VMs hosted on each node.
        Returns:
        an array of variable counting the number of VMs on each node

      • makeVarLabel

        String makeVarLabel(Object... lbl)
        Make a label for a variable iff the labelling is enabled
        Parameters:
        lbl - the label to make
        Returns:
        the label that will be used in practice

      • getManageableVMs

        Set<VM> getManageableVMs()
        Get the VMs managed by the solver. This set contains all the VMs that will have their state changed plus the set of manageable running VMs that was passed to the constructor.
        Returns:
        a set of VMs identifier

      • getLogger

        org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
        Get the logger.
        Returns:
        well, the logger

      • getObjectiveAlterer

        ObjectiveAlterer getObjectiveAlterer()
        Get the alterer that is used to manipulate the objective value each time a solution is computed
        Returns:
        the alterer. By default it is an instance of DefaultObjectiveAlterer.

      • setObjectiveAlterer

        void setObjectiveAlterer(ObjectiveAlterer a)
        Set the alterer to use for this problem
        Parameters:
        a - the alterer to use

      • cloneVM

        VM cloneVM(VM vm)
        Create a clone of a given VM. The clone will take the place of the VM by the end of the reconfiguration process.
        Parameters:
        vm - the identifier of the VM to substitute
        Returns:
        the identifier of the new VM. null if the process failed

      • setObjective

        void setObjective(boolean b,
                  solver.variables.IntVar v)
        Set the optimisation variable.
        Parameters:
        b - true to minimise the value. false to maximise it
        v - the variable to optimise

      • getObjective

        solver.variables.IntVar getObjective()
        Get the optimisation variable
        Returns:
        a variable that is null if #getResolutionPolicy() == ResolutionPolicy#SATISFACTION

      • getResolutionPolicy

        solver.ResolutionPolicy getResolutionPolicy()
        Get the current resolution policy.
        Returns:
        the current resolution policy
